com.accesium.sendtopush
Class SendToPushManager

java.lang.Object
  com.accesium.sendtopush.SendToPushManager

public class SendToPushManager
extends java.lang.Object

Class that encapsulate the register and unregister in push server. It handles the registration in Google's server, querying a push token. After this, it is registered within our push server by sending the required parameters.

Author:
Isidoro Castell

getInstance

public static SendToPushManager getInstance()
                                     throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
Return, in case of it exists, an instance of SendToPushManager. This call has to be done before init(String, String, String, String), otherwise an exception will be launched.

Returns:
The instance of the object
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the object has not been initialized

init

public static SendToPushManager init(java.lang.String apiKey,
                                     java.lang.String company,
                                     java.lang.String appname,
                                     java.lang.String gcmSenderId,
                                     Environment environment)
Initialize the object, in case of it not exists, with the given parameters obtained from the server. If we have already initialized the object the old instance will be returned.

Parameters:
apiKey - Generated in the push server, when the project has been register
company - Company registered in the push server
appname - Name of the application in the push server
gcmSenderId - The GCM Sender ID obtained from Google APIs Console page
environment - The environment which the application is executed
Returns:
An instance of the object created

register

public void register(Context context,
                     java.lang.String appUsername,
                     PushResponseListener listener)
Start the registration process. First it queries the GCM token, once this is done it is registered in our push server.

Parameters:
context - The application context
appUsername - The user name to save in our push server. This will be used to send push messages.
listener - The callback to receive if the query was successful or not.

handleRegistration

protected void handleRegistration(Context context,
                                  Intent intent)
Handles a registration message from GCM and registers in our server with the token received. When the process is done it notifies to the IPushResponseListener given.

Parameters:
context - The application context
intent - The intent received as broadcast message from GCM

unregister

public void unregister(Context context,
                       PushResponseListener listener)
Unregister from the GCM server and our push server

Parameters:
context - The application context
listener - The callback for the status of the process.

configure

public void configure(Context context,
                      PushStateType sound,
                      PushStateType vibration,
                      boolean autocancel,
                      java.lang.String title,
                      java.lang.String iconResourceName)
Method to configure the notification behavior

Parameters:
context - The application context
sound - Whether enable sound or not, or use the system configuration
vibration - Whether enable vibration or not, or use the system configuration
autocancel - If the notification is cancel when it is pressed or is permanent.
title - The notification title
iconResource - The resource name of the thumbnail to show in a notification

setDefaultConfiguration

public void setDefaultConfiguration(Context context)
Delete the existing configuration and set the default values

Parameters:
context - The application context
